Name: blastoma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives_from precursor cells called blast cells.

Name: malignant adenoma
Definition: A mitochondrial metabolism disease that is characterized by delayed psychomotor development and lactic acidosis with a normal lactate/pyruvate ratio resulting from impaired mitochondrial pyruvate oxidation and has_material_basis_in homozygous mutation in the BRP44L gene on chromosome 6q27.

Name: sarcoma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives from embryonic mesoderm.
Synonym: tumor of soft tissue and skeleton

Name: obsolete glaucoma due to raised episcleral venous pressure
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives from embryonic mesoderm.
Synonym: Glaucoma with increased episcleral venous pressure (disorder)

Name: mixed cell type cancer
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives_from two germinal layers of tissue.

Name: malignant mesothelioma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in mesothelial tissue that develops from the thin layer of tissue that covers many of the internal organs.

Name: melanoma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives_from melanocytes which are found in skin

Name: germ cell cancer
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives_from germ cells.
Synonym: malignant tumor of the germ cell

Name: obsolete ovarian mixed germ cell-sex cord neoplasm
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives_from germ cells.
Synonym: Ovarian mixed germ cell-Sex Cord tumor

Name: carcinoma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives_from epithelial cells.

Name: malignant glioma
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in glial cells and is located in brain or located in spine.

Name: mesenchymal cell neoplasm
Definition: A cell type cancer that has_material_basis_in abnormally proliferating cells derives from embryonic connective tissue that is capable of developing into connective tissue
